intro: Epilobium hammondii, commonly known as Hammond's willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Epilobium hammondii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
